snippet: The findings were the latest in a series of studies prompted by a military suicide rate that has nearly doubled since 2005.
abstract: Study published in JAMA Psychiatry, largest examination to date of climbing suicide rate among military personnel, finds no connection between suicide and deployment in support of wars in Iraq and Afghanistan; studies have been prompted by military suicide rate almost doubling since 2005.
lead_paragraph: The findings were the latest in a series of studies prompted by a military suicide rate that has nearly doubled since 2005.

headline.main: Study Finds No Link Between Military Suicide Rate and Deployments
headline.print_headline: New Findings on Suicides in the Military

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
